noun.description: A piece of thick absorbent cloth or paper used for drying oneself or wiping things dry.

verb.description: Wipe or dry (a person or thing) with a towel.
examples: we'd towel off and dress for dinner

origin: Middle English: from Old French toaille, of Germanic origin. Sense 2 of the verb dates from the early 18th century; sense 1 from the mid 19th century.
